The 1970–71 Montenegrin Republic League was 26th season of Montenegrin Republic League. Season started in August 1970 and finished in May 1971.
Season
|position=left}}
}}
On season 1970–71, in Montenegrin Republic League participated 12 teams. Among the teams which didn't play during the previous season were Zabjelo and Jedinstvo (relegated from Second League) and the two best teams from Regional leagues - Gorštak and Kom.[http://www.barskiportal.com/lat/sport/u-susret-stogodi%C5%A1njici-fudbala-u-baru-9-novija-istorija-mornara.php U susret stogodišnjici fudbala u Baru (9.): "Novija" istorija Mornara]
After 22 weeks, the title won Bokelj, with only one point more than Rudar Pljevlja. With that result, Iskra gained a promotion to Yugoslav Second League. Three lowest ranked teams - Dečić and Spuž were relegated to Regional leagues (fourth level).

Higher leagues
On season 1970–71, six Montenegrin teams played in higher leagues of SFR Yugoslavia.[http://www.fsgzrenjanin.com/Period%201968-1973.html FSG] All of them (Budućnost, Sutjeska, Lovćen, OFK Titograd and Iskra) participated in 1970–71 Yugoslav Second League.
